ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Built a solid foundation of grammar, characters, speaking, listening, writing, and reading skills.
Reading, writing, speaking, and listening to elementary Chinese vocabulary and grammar.

This course is extremely helpful for learning Chinese -- I've learned more Chinese in this semester than I learned French over two years in high school. I think learning a language is inherently an extremely useful skill in that it helps you speak to people you previously could not but I also think it is a great exercise for the brain, to keep it engaged. Provides insight into Chinese culture as well.
Learned how to write characters, read, and speak Chinese.
how to speak, write, and understand mandarin.
Chinese grammar, vocabulary, and characters. We learned the various tones and sentence structures for Mandarin.
Learned to read, speak, and write Chinese!
Elementary Chinese.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: Quickly learn Chinese with solid foundations 
Weakness: Very time consuming (which is likely unavoidable)

Strengths: Planning and assignments were clear and highly organized. Significant improvement in language ability in a relatively short time.
Weaknesses: Course load was very high and the intensity of the course sometimes made it difficult to retain new information and stay motivated.

Strengths include the dedication of the instructors to their students both in teaching and in providing them with a safe & warm learning environment. The small classroom sizes foster a great environment to both practice repeatedly and get closer to your peers so as to feel comfortable practicing with them outside of class.
More character writing in class
Very organized; amazing professor
I believe that the course load is too much, stoping most students from continuing the language even though it is very useful on

Strength - Incredibly interactive, meets everyday, focuses on speaking ability over memorization of characters
Weakness - Heavy workload but you do learn!

Strength: The course is amazing in teaching beginners to speak Chinese well. Course is well-facilitated to make sure each student is improving in reading, writing, and speaking. Ao Laoshi is amazing and so sweet!

Weakness: Grading scale (being over 100%) was a confusing system to understand. The vocabulary for daily quizzes sometimes did not align with what was presented on the weekly schedule.

It is a brilliant course  the teachers, the curriculum etc. all great.  The one thing I would improve is making the homework less frequent/less lengthy (e.g. halving the number of presentations).

Ao Jingjing is an INCREDIBLE teacher.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if a student is able to dedicate around 2 hours a day to studying and has the ambition to learn Chinese without shortcuts.
I would recommend this course to those serious about learning Chinese and willing to spend a significant amount of time and effort on learning the language.
Yes! Strongly recommend, with the caveat that it requires a strong commitment to the heavy workload. You will get out of the class what you put in!
Yes. This course will help you learn Chinese. It is challenging but extremely rewarding.
Yes! You learn so much
I recommend this to students who truly want to learn a useful but very challenging language and to understand that it will only be useful if you dedicated a lot of your time towards it.
Yes, the Chinese program at Yale is very strong!
Absolutely for reasons above.
